what: Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
title: Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
text: Create scenario alignment table

title: Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
text: data data frame. principle, output prep_alignment_table(). Requirements: asset_class must single value. Must columns: asset_class,sector,technology, entity, aligned_scen_temp, perc_aum. entity must contain least one value "portfolio". sector must one : "power", "fossil_fuels", "automotive". aligned_scen_temp must one : ">3.2C", "2.7-3.2C", "<2C". perc_aum must percentage decimal format, values 0 1.

title: Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
text: object class "ggplot".

title: Create a scenario alignment table — plot_alignment_table
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  plot_alignment_table(toy_data_alignment_table %>% filter(asset_class == "equity"))

what: Create a diagram of asset class coverage — plot_diagram
title: Create a diagram of asset class coverage — plot_diagram
text: Create diagram asset class coverage

title: Create a diagram of asset class coverage — plot_diagram
Create a diagram of asset class coverage — plot_diagram
text: data data frame. principle output prep_diagram(). Requirements: Must columns: asset_class, exposure_portfolio, exposure_asset_class, exposure_asset_class_perc, exposure_pacta, exposure_pacta_perc_asset_class_exposure, emissions_pacta_perc, emissions_pacta. Must two rows. asset_class must values: "equity", "bonds". exposure_portfolio, exposure_asset_class, exposure_asset_class_perc, exposure_pacta, exposure_pacta_perc_asset_class_exposure, emissions_pacta_perc, emissions_pacta must numeric. exposure_asset_class_perc, exposure_pacta_perc_asset_class_exposure, emissions_pacta_perc must percentage decimal format, values 0 1.

title: Create a diagram of asset class coverage — plot_diagram
text: object class "htmlwidget".

text: data data frame. principle, output prep_exposures_survey(). Requirements: Must columns: asset_class, entity, sector, exposure_perc_aum. asset_class must single value. entity must one : "portfolio", "peers". sector must one PACTA sectors. text: data data frame. principle, output prep_scores(). Requirements: Must columns: asset_class,scope,entity, sector, score. asset_class must single value. scope must one : "portfolio", "sector". entity must following values: "this_portfolio", "peers". sector must one : "power", "automotive", "coal", "oil", "gas", "steel", "aviation" NA case scope == "portfolio". score must one : "+", "", "B", "C", "D", "E".

text: object class "ggplot".

title: Create a plot showing aggregated score in scorecard — plot_scores_scorecard
code: data <- toy_data_scores %>%   dplyr::filter(     scope == "portfolio",     entity == "this_portfolio"   ) plot_scores_scorecard(data) #> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will #> replace the existing one. #> Scale for fill is already present. #> Adding another scale for fill, which will replace the existing scale. #> Scale for colour is already present. #> Adding another scale for colour, which will replace the existing scale.

text: results_portfolio Data frame contains pre-wrangled portfolio level PACTA results PACTA investors analysis. peers_results_aggregated Data frame contains pre-wrangled aggregate peer group level PACTA results PACTA investors analysis. asset_class Character defining asset class data. Must either "equity" "bonds" scenario_source Character. Must scenario_source featured scenario_thresholds data set.

title: Render a raster object — rasterGrob
text: See grid::rasterGrob details.

title: Render a raster object — rasterGrob
code: rasterGrob(image, x = unit(0.5, "npc"), y = unit(0.5, "npc"),   width = NULL, height = NULL, just = "centre", hjust = NULL, vjust = NULL,   interpolate = TRUE, default.units= "npc", name = NULL, gp = gpar(),   vp = NULL)

title: Render a raster object — rasterGrob
text: image R object can coerced raster object. x numeric vector unit object specifying x-location. y numeric vector unit object specifying y-location. width numeric vector unit object specifying width. height numeric vector unit object specifying height. just justification rectangle relative (x, y) location. two values, first value specifies horizontal justification second value specifies vertical justification. Possible string values : "left", "right", "centre", "center", "bottom", "top". numeric values, 0 means left alignment 1 means right alignment. hjust numeric vector specifying horizontal justification. specified, overrides just setting. vjust numeric vector specifying vertical justification. specified, overrides just setting. default.units string indicating default units use x, y, width, height given numeric vectors. name character identifier. gp object class "gpar", typically output call function gpar. basically list graphical parameter settings. vp Grid viewport object (NULL). interpolate string indicating default units use x, y, width, height given numeric vectors.

title: Render a raster object — rasterGrob
text: rastergrob grob.

what: Read a bitmap image stored in the PNG format — readPNG
title: Read a bitmap image stored in the PNG format — readPNG
text: See png::readPNG details.

title: Read a bitmap image stored in the PNG format — readPNG
Read a bitmap image stored in the PNG format — readPNG
text: source Either name file read raw vector representing PNG file content. native determines image representation - FALSE (default) result array, TRUE result native raster representation. info logical, TRUE additional "info" attribute attached result containing information optional tags file (bit depth, resolution, gamma, text etc.). PNG file contains R metadata, also contain "metadata" attribute unserialized R object.

title: Read a bitmap image stored in the PNG format — readPNG
text: native FALSE array dimensions height x width x channels. one channel result matrix. values reals 0 1. native TRUE object class nativeRaster returned instead. latter easily computed efficient way draw using rasterImage.

title: Renders executive summary — render_executive_summary
text: Renders executive summary

title: Renders executive summary — render_executive_summary
code: render_executive_summary(   data,   language,   output_dir,   exec_summary_dir,   survey_dir,   score_card_dir,   analysis_inputs_dir,   file_name = "template.Rmd",   investor_name,   portfolio_name,   peer_group,   total_portfolio,   scenario_source = "WEO2023",   scenario_selected = "NZE_2050",   currency_exchange_value,   log_dir )

title: Renders executive summary — render_executive_summary
text: data List data frames format returned prep_data_executive_summary() language Character single, valid two letter language identifier uppercase e.g. "EN" output_dir Character single, valid filepath directory output saved exec_summary_dir Character single, valid filepath directory contains template, e.g. system.file("extdata", "PA2022CH_en_exec_summary", package = "pacta.executive.summary") survey_dir Character single, valid filepath directory contains survey files user score_card_dir Character single, valid filepath directory contains score card files user analysis_inputs_dir Character single, valid filepath PACTA analysis results directory contains SBTi data merged financial data COP case file_name Character single, valid filename Rmd template file, e.g. "template.Rmd" investor_name Character single string specifying investor name portfolio_name Character single string specifying portfolio name peer_group Character single string specifying peer group total_portfolio Data frame contains total portfolio found standard PACTA processed inputs file "total_portfolio.rds" scenario_source Character single string specifying selected scenario source, e.g. "GECO2023" scenario_selected Character single string specifying selected scenario, e.g. "1.5C" currency_exchange_value Numeric single numeric value specifying exchange rate USD desired display currency, e.g. 1.03 log_dir Character single, valid filepath directory contain log file

title: Renders executive summary — render_executive_summary
text: pdf document written output_dir
